page.title: 13Transport around Brafferton
page.content:
The area surrounding the A167 is well served by{public transport.}There are some 6 services passing along the road that provide a bus every 10 minutes. However Brafferton itself lies about a mile from the main road and has only 1 service on an hourly basis. This service is erratic and the elderly residents of the village in particular complain of the inconvenience.
For farmers and other locals, {private transport}is essential especially where there are children to be taken to school or to the main road for the school bus.
There is also a{mainline railway { line}(but no station) in the area which is on the London to Scotland route.
